title: MagicArticulate: Make Your 3D Models Articulation-Ready
author: Chaoyue Song (Nanyang Technological University), Jianfeng Zhang (ByteDance Seed), Xiu Li (ByteDance Seed), Fan Yang (Nanyang Technological University), Yiwen Chen (Nanyang Technological University), Zhongcong Xu (ByteDance Seed), Jun Hao Liew (ByteDance Seed), Guosheng Lin (Nanyang Technological University), ...
relevance_why: This paper's focus on automating the articulation of 3D models can relate to generative audio tasks, especially where 3D modeling intersects with audio/visual content creation.
background: Transforming static 3D models into articulation-ready versions to facilitate realistic animations, which traditionally requires manual labor.
contribution: MagicArticulate introduces the Articulation-XL dataset and a two-stage framework for automatic skeleton generation and skinning weight prediction, achieving high-quality articulation.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods rely on manual annotations or predefined templates that are limited in flexibility and scalability, especially in diverse object categories.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by leveraging a large-scale dataset and auto-regressive modeling to flexibly adapt skeleton creation to various 3D structures without rigid templates.

key_innovation: The use of an autoregressive transformer for skeleton generation allows for dynamic handling of varying numbers of bones and joints, ensuring specificity for each 3D shape.
real_world_impact: The framework streamlines the process of creating articulation-ready 3D assets, significantly benefiting animation and gaming industries by reducing manual labor and time.

new_terms.articulation: **Articulation** refers to the way in which different parts of a model move or are connected, crucial for realistic modeling and animation.
new_terms.skin weights: **Skin weights** are numerical values that determine how much influence each joint has on the movement of vertices in a mesh.
